etymology.description: pictogram: empty container/chalice; handles conjoined in the modern form
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an empty vessel, like a bowl or chalice seen from above. Over time, the side handles merged into the compact dish shape used today.

examples.chinese: 这些玻璃器皿需要小心清洗(這些玻璃器皿需要小心清洗)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèxiē bōli qìmǐn xūyào xiǎoxīn qīngxǐ.
examples.english: These glass vessels need to be cleaned carefully.

examples.chinese: 科学家把样本放进培养皿观察(科學家把樣本放進培養皿觀察)。
examples.pinyin: Kēxuéjiā bǎ yàngběn fàngjìn péiyǎng mǐn guānchá.
examples.english: The scientist placed the sample in a Petri dish to observe it.

examples.chinese: 厨房里的器皿摆放得很整齐(廚房裡的器皿擺放得很整齊)。
examples.pinyin: Chúfáng lǐ de qìmǐn bǎifàng de hěn zhěngqí.
examples.english: The kitchen vessels are arranged very neatly.
